thread.title: A big teario to Inspector George Gently and Doc Martin
thread.title_full: A big teario to Inspector George Gently and Doc Martin

author: Mark Jefferies
title: A big teario to Inspector George Gently and Doc Martin
text:
TV A big teario to Inspector George Gently and Doc Martin Two favourite characters, who have both been on screen for over a decade, will be saying goodbye after their next series Share Martin Shaw is bowing out as Inspector George Gently (Photo: PA Photo/BBC/Mark Bourdillon) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Two much-loved characters, each on our TVs for more than a decade, are finally coming to an end. 
The BBC ’s Inspector George Gently begins filming its final series this week after 23 episodes, with Martin Shaw as the DCI and Lee Ingleby as Insp Bacchus in two feature-length films set in the North East. 
And ITV’s comedy-drama Doc Martin, starring Martin Clunes , will also come to the end of the road next year. The final two films in George Gently are set in 1970, with change in the air, Cold War political paranoia and looming industrial unrest. 
One film sees Gently involved in an investigation that may be a miscarriage of justice and the second has him giving evidence against corrupt police officers at the Old Bailey. Read More Caroline Quentin hints at TV comeback for 90s sitcom Men Behaving Badly Martin Clunes has said Doc Martin will be ending after the next series (Photo: ITV) 
Preparing for his final scenes, Shaw, 71, says: “It’s wonderful to be coming back to the show. We’re a very happy and close company, and working with such friends is a joy. 
“I’m excited at being able to bring the series to a proper finale.” 
ITV’s Doc Martin has been on screens for more than 12 years but Clunes, 55 – who portrays the brilliant blood-fearing GP – has told Radio Times the show will conclude after series nine in 2018. 
Followers will be upset that the series is nearing its end. But the cast are far from down-hearted – they thought the show would wrap up after the series seven party. Like us on Facebook
